news.title: Boeing 787 bound for London with 242 aboard crashes after takeoff in India, casualties reported
news.summary: The cause of the crash wasn’t immediately known and could take months to determine. The NTSB is investigating the crash. The crash happened on a busy highway near the city of San Francisco.

news.title: Trump wanted an Iran nuclear deal fast. Now he may get military confrontation
news.summary: The Pentagon ordered the withdrawal of some American personnel from embassies in Iraq, Kuwait and Bahrain. The move comes as tensions spike between the U.S., Israel and Iran.

news.title: Meta files lawsuit against developer of CrushAI 'nudify' app
news.summary: The lawsuit is against Joy Timeline HK Ltd., which used Meta ads to promote an app that uses AI to take a photo of someone and create nude imagery of them.

news.title: GameStop shares tank on convertible bond offering to potentially buy more bitcoin
news.summary: The video game retailer announced plans for a $1.75 billion convertible notes. The notes will partially fund its bitcoin purchase. The deal is expected to be completed by the end of the year.

news.title: Oil prices fall as traders watch Israel-Iran conflict

news.title: I have $1,000 in credit-card debt. Will I be able to hide my inheritance from the bank?
news.summary: “The debt stems from over five years ago, and I forgot about it,” he said. “The money is in my bank account, and it’s not going anywhere.”

news.title: I’m in my 80s and have 2 kids. How do I choose between them to be my executor?
news.summary: ‘One child has acquired significant knowledge of contracts, legal documents and business procedures, but will be relocating 1,500 miles’

news.title: A local restaurant has a 5% container charge and 3% kitchen-service fee. Is this as nuts as it sounds?
news.summary: “It’s not about whether I can afford it or not,” she said of tipping. “Please don’t tell me to ‘eat at home if you can’n afford to tip’”

news.title: Jobless claims hold steady at 8-month high. Economists blame the end of the school year.
news.summary: There is “no evidence that the labor market is rolling over,” says one economist. While there are signs of softening, there is ‘no evidence’ that it’s ‘rolling over’

news.title: Gundlach says gold is no longer for lunatics as the bond king says wait to buy the 30-year
news.summary: Jeff Gundlach has a ton of ideas about where to invest right now. U.S. markets may be the least of those, he says.
